summary: human caliciviruses (HuCV) including norovirus (NoV, genogroup GI and GII) and sapovirus (SaV) is a leading cause of acute sporadic diarrhea in individuals across all age groups. few studies had been conducted clarifying the characteristics of HuCV in diarrhea cases across all age groups in southwest china. GII.3 (n = 28, 23.7 %), GII.12 (n = 25, 21.2 %), GII.17 (n = 8, 6.8 %), and GII.5 (n = 2, 1.7 %) of the 55 GII.4 strains. the GII.4 Sydney 2012 variant had absolutely predominant prevalence.
